file_content.text: I'm sure you'll do us proud on the planet.
I'm sure you'll give the Republic a new reason to hate the planet, my lord.
Make those Republic dogs bleed while you're down there.
Attention! VIPs in the room. Let's show some respect!
Attention! A lord is present!
At ease. Let's get this started.
Good to have you with us. The men were wondering if they'd get to see the VIP.
Ostensibly, the conflict on Hoth is over salvage from a battle that happened above the planet. In reality, it is our trap for the Republic.
I hadn't heard anything about a trap on Hoth. Explain.
You've got my attention.
The fight with the Republic has lasted for years now. The objective on Hoth is not to end the battle, but to sustain it.
So the salvage is worthless? Or is it just too hard to get to?
What kind of trap?
A bit of each. There is a fairly major pirate force that holds much of what the Republic wishes to recover.
I am not the patient sort.
The Imperial plan is not to gain ground, but rather, to make the battle as costly as possible to the Republic.
We want our forces small and mobile, and while the Republic keeps chasing victory, we bleed them dry of personnel and equipment.
I hope there's still room in this plan for mass slaughter.
I'll fight how I please.
I'll, uh, defer to your judgment on that score, my lord.
I will extend their misery with every blow I strike.
I can do that.
Yes, my lord. Misery's easy enough to find on Hoth.
Hit and run. Not glorious, just effective.
So we use guerilla tactics.
Exactly. Why capture a base when you can force the enemy to spend credits defending it?
You'll need good intelligence for that.
I'll be useful, then.
It is a certainty, sir. Good to have you on board.
Done.
Very well.
Very good, my lord.
If you say so, sir.
The strategy seems sound. How will it change what I do?
So how does this affect me?
It means we will rely heavily on small-unit groups, such as yourself, to cause damage and withdraw. Pitched battles are lost battles.
Excuse me, everyone. I didn't mean to interrupt, but I brought your cold-weather equipment.
My lord, forgive the interruption. I brought by your cold-weather equipment.
Sir, forgive the interruption. I brought by your survival equipment.
We were just finishing, Ensign.
This should keep your core body temperature up. When you're ready, report to a pilot in the shuttle bay for transport to the planet.
Colonel Vannis at Dorn Base will be waiting for you. Good luck down there.
Hoth briefing in a few minutes. Mandatory for all those going planetside.
